00036 void readCopyNumberFile(CopyNumberMap &copyNumberMap,
00037                         const std::string& copyNumberFilePath){
00038 
00039     // The format of the file that is read by this function is assumed to have the form: 
00040     /*
00041           sample_id     <marker1>       <marker2>       etc.
00042           <sample1>     <copyNumber>    <copyNumber>    etc.
00043           <sample2>     <copyNumber>    <copyNumber>    etc.    
00044           .         .               .
00045           .         .               . 
00046       etc.         etc.            etc.
00047     */
00048 
00049 //     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00050         affx::File5_File cn_file5;
00051     string sampleName;
00052         vector<string> markerNames;
00053     int markerCount;
00054     string label;
00055 
00056     /* sanity checks */
00057     if (cn_file5.open(copyNumberFilePath, affx::FILE5_OPEN) != FILE5_OK) {
00058         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + string(copyNumberFilePath) + " to read.");
00059     }
00060     string file_name = Fs::basename(copyNumberFilePath);
00061         Util::changeEnd(file_name, ".a5", "");
00062     affx::File5_Tsv *cn_file5_tsv = cn_file5.openTsv(file_name);
00063     cn_file5_tsv->getColumnName(0, 0, &label);
00064     if (label != "sample_id") {
00065                 Err::errAbort("sample_id must be the first column header in the copyNumber file, instead of:'" + label + "'");
00066         }
00067 
00068     markerCount = cn_file5_tsv->getColumnCount(0); 
00069 
00070     for (int i=1; i<markerCount; ++i) {
00071                 label.clear();
00072                 cn_file5_tsv->getColumnName(0, i, &label);
00073                 markerNames.push_back(label);
00074                 vector<int> temp;
00075                 copyNumberMap[label] = temp;
00076     }
00077 
00078     ///@todo cannot assume that the order is the same!
00079     while (cn_file5_tsv->nextLevel(0) == FILE5_OK) {
00080         for (int i=1; i<markerCount; i++) {
00081             int val;                             
00082             if (cn_file5_tsv->get(0, i, &val)==FILE5_OK) {
00083                 copyNumberMap[markerNames[i-1]].push_back(val);
00084             }
00085             else {
00086                 Err::errAbort("Unable to read column " + ToStr(i) + " from copyNumber file");
00087             }
00088         }
00089     }
00090     //
00091     cn_file5_tsv->close();
00092     delete cn_file5_tsv;
00093 }

00096 void readSpecialSnpsFile(SpecialSnpMap *specialSnps,
00097                          std::string *chipType,
00098                          std::string *specialSnpVersion,
00099                          const std::string& specialSnpsPath)
00100 {
00101     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00102     string snpName;
00103     string chrom;
00104     int malecopy;
00105     int femalecopy;
00106     pair<int,int> duty;
00107     string specialType, chip;
00108     chipType->clear();
00109     specialSnpVersion->clear();
00110     tsv.bind(0, "probeset_id", &snpName, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00111     tsv.bind(0, "chr", &chrom, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00112     tsv.bind(0,"copy_male",&malecopy,TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00113     tsv.bind(0,"copy_female",&femalecopy,TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00114     /* sanity checks */
00115     if (tsv.open(specialSnpsPath) != TSV_OK) 
00116         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + string(specialSnpsPath) + " to read.");
00117     // set the special snps type.
00118     if (tsv.headersFindNext("special-snp-version", specialType) == TSV_OK) {
00119         *specialSnpVersion = specialType;
00120     }
00121     // read chipType from header
00122     while (tsv.headersFindNext("chip-type", chip) == TSV_OK) {
00123         *chipType = chip;
00124     }
00125     while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00126         duty.first=malecopy;
00127         duty.second=femalecopy; 
00128         (*specialSnps)[snpName] = duty;
00129     }
00130     tsv.close();
00131 }
00132 
00133 void readSpecialSampleSnpsFile(SpecialSampleSnpMap *specialSampleSnps,
00134                                SpecialSampleNameVector *specialSampleName,
00135                                const std::string& specialSampleSnpsPath)
00136 {
00137     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00138     string snpName;
00139     vector<int> sample;
00140     int sampleCount;
00141     string specialType, chip;
00142     string label;
00143 
00144     /* sanity checks */
00145     if (tsv.open(specialSampleSnpsPath) != TSV_OK) 
00146         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + string(specialSampleSnpsPath) + " to read.");
00147     tsv.cidx2cname(0,0,label);
00148     if (label != "probeset_id")
00149         Err::errAbort("probeset_id must be the first column in the specialSampleSnps file");
00150     sampleCount = tsv.getColumnCount(0); 
00151     specialSampleName->resize(sampleCount);
00152     for (int i=1; i<sampleCount; ++i) {
00153         label.clear();
00154         tsv.cidx2cname(0, i, label);
00155         specialSampleName->push_back(label);
00156     }
00157     while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00158         snpName.clear();
00159         if (tsv.get(0,0,snpName)!=TSV_OK)
00160             Err::errAbort("Unable to read column " + ToStr(0) + " from specialSampleSnps file");
00161         sample.clear();
00162         for (int i=1; i<sampleCount; i++) {
00163             int val;
00164             if (tsv.get(0,i,val)==TSV_OK)
00165                 sample.push_back(val);
00166             else
00167                 Err::errAbort("Unable to read column " + ToStr(i) + " from specialSampleSnps file");
00168         }
00169         (*specialSampleSnps)[snpName] = sample;
00170     }
00171     tsv.close();
00172 }

00174 void makeSpecialSnpsFromChrXFile(SpecialSnpMap *specialSnps,const std::string& chrXPath)
00175 {
00176     vector<string> chrXSNPNames;
00177     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00178     string snpName;
00179 
00180     tsv.bind(0, "all_chrx_no_par", &snpName, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00181     /* sanity checks */
00182     if (tsv.open(chrXPath) != TSV_OK) 
00183         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + string(chrXPath) + " to read.");
00184     while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00185         chrXSNPNames.push_back(snpName);
00186     }
00187     pair<int,int> thePair(1, 2);
00188     for (vector<string>::const_iterator it = chrXSNPNames.begin();
00189          it != chrXSNPNames.end(); ++it) {
00190         (*specialSnps)[*it] = thePair;
00191     }
00192     tsv.close();
00193 }

00195 void haploidFromSpecial(SpecialSnpMap &SpecialSnps, map<string,bool> &haploidSnps ){
00196     SpecialSnpMapIter mapIter;
00197     /*for (mapIter = SpecialSnps.begin(); mapIter != SpecialSnps.end(); mapIter++) {
00198       printf("%s %d %d\n",mapIter->first.c_str(),mapIter->second.first,mapIter->second.second);
00199       }*/
00200     // grab off just the haploid snps
00201     // take a random sample of 10K (or actual size)
00202     vector<string> TmpName;
00203     for (mapIter = SpecialSnps.begin(); mapIter != SpecialSnps.end(); mapIter++) {
00204         if (mapIter->second.first==1 && mapIter->second.second==2) {
00205             // load up the hypothetical chrX snps
00206             TmpName.push_back(mapIter->first);
00207         }
00208     }
00209     int i;
00210     vector<string> SampleName;
00211     int Xsamplesize=10000;
00212 
00213     if (TmpName.size()>Xsamplesize) {
00214         SampleName.resize(Xsamplesize);
00215         reproducible_random_sample(TmpName.begin(), TmpName.end(),
00216                                    SampleName.begin(), SampleName.size(), 42);
00217     }
00218     else {
00219         SampleName.resize(TmpName.size());
00220         for (i=0; i<TmpName.size(); i++)
00221             SampleName[i]=TmpName[i];
00222     }
00223     haploidSnps.clear();
00224     for (i=0; i<SampleName.size(); i++) {
00225         haploidSnps[SampleName[i]]=true;
00226     }
00227 }
00228 
00229 void specialFromHaploid(SpecialSnpMap &SpecialSnps, map<string,bool> &haploidSnps){
00230     SpecialSnps.clear();
00231     map<string, bool >::iterator mapIter;
00232     pair<int,int> duty;
00233     for (mapIter = haploidSnps.begin(); mapIter != haploidSnps.end(); mapIter++) {
00234 
00235         duty.first=1;
00236         duty.second=2;
00237         SpecialSnps[mapIter->first]=duty;
00238     }
00239 }
00240 
00241 /**
00242  * Open a text file and read in snps that are possibly haploid. Currently
00243  * only chrX snps are supported.
00244  *
00245  * @param file        - chrX file to read
00246  * @param haploidSnps - Map of probeset names that are marked as chrX
00247  * @param layout      - 
00248  */
00249 void fillInHaploidSnpsVersion1(string file, map<string,bool> &haploidSnps, ChipLayout *layout, bool permissive) {
00250     int cnt = 0;
00251     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00252     string snpName;
00253     tsv.bind(0, "all_chrx_no_par", &snpName, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00254     /* sanity checks */
00255     if (tsv.open(file) != TSV_OK)
00256         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + file + " to read.");
00257     while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00258         if (permissive || (layout != NULL && layout->containsProbeSet(snpName.c_str())))
00259             haploidSnps[snpName] = true;
00260         else
00261             Err::errAbort("Can't find chrX snp: " + snpName + " in cdf file. Wrong chrX file?");
00262         cnt++;
00263     }
00264     tsv.close();
00265     Verbose::out(1,"Read " + ToStr(cnt) + " ChrX SNPs from chrX SNPs file " + file + " (v1)");
00266 }
00267 
00268 /**
00269  * Open a text file and read in snps that are possibly haploid. Currently
00270  * only chrX snps are supported.
00271  *
00272  * @param file        - chrX file to read
00273  * @param haploidSnps - Map of probeset names that are marked as chrX
00274  * @param layout      -
00275  * @param permissive  -
00276  */
00277 void fillInHaploidSnpsVersion2(string file,
00278                                std::map<std::string,bool> &haploidSnps,
00279                                ChipLayout *layout,
00280                                bool permissive) {
00281     int cnt = 0;
00282     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00283     string snpName;
00284     string chrom;
00285     tsv.bind(0, "Probeset", &snpName, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00286     tsv.bind(0, "chr", &chrom, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00287     /* sanity checks */
00288     if (tsv.open(file) != TSV_OK)
00289         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + file + " to read.");
00290     while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00291         if (permissive || (layout != NULL && layout->containsProbeSet(snpName.c_str()))) {
00292             if (chrom == "X") {
00293                 haploidSnps[snpName] = true;
00294                 cnt++;
00295             }
00296         }
00297         else
00298             Err::errAbort("Can't find snp: " + snpName + " on chrom: " + chrom + " in cdf file. Wrong chrx file?");
00299     }
00300     tsv.close();
00301     Verbose::out(1,"Read " + ToStr(cnt) + " ChrX SNPs from chrX SNPs file " + file + " (v2)");
00302 }
00303 
00304 /**
00305  * Determine which version of a chrx snp have and open appropriately
00306  *
00307  * @param file        - chrX file to read
00308  * @param haploidSnps - Map of probeset names that are marked as chrX
00309  * @param layout      -
00310  * @param permissive  -
00311  */
00312 void fillInHaploidSnps(string file,
00313                        std::map<std::string,bool> &haploidSnps,
00314                        ChipLayout *layout,
00315                        bool permissive) {
00316     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00317     string version;
00318     string key = "version";
00319     if (tsv.open(file) != TSV_OK)
00320         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + file + " to read.");
00321     // Is there an explicit setting for version?
00322     if (tsv.getHeader(key, version) == TSV_OK) {
00323         tsv.close();
00324         if (version == "2") {
00325             fillInHaploidSnpsVersion2(file, haploidSnps, layout, permissive);
00326         }
00327         else {
00328             Err::errAbort("In file: " + file + " Don't know how to handle version: " + version);
00329         }
00330     }
00331     // if not assume version one and move forward.
00332     else {
00333         tsv.close();
00334         fillInHaploidSnpsVersion1(file, haploidSnps, layout, permissive);
00335     }
00336 }
00337 
00338 bool isChrX(const SpecialSnpMapIter& specialSnp) {
00339     bool result = false;
00340     std::pair<int,int> maleFemaleCnPair = specialSnp->second;
00341     if (maleFemaleCnPair.first == 1 && maleFemaleCnPair.second == 2) {
00342         result = true;
00343     }
00344     return result;
00345 }
00346 
00347 bool isChrY(const SpecialSnpMapIter& specialSnp) {
00348     bool result = false;
00349     std::pair<int,int> maleFemaleCnPair = specialSnp->second;
00350     if (maleFemaleCnPair.first == 1 && maleFemaleCnPair.second == 0) {
00351         result = true;
00352     }
00353     return result;
00354 }
00355 
00356 bool isHaploid(const SpecialSnpMapIter& specialSnp) {
00357     bool result = false;
00358     if (isChrX(specialSnp) || isChrY(specialSnp)) {
00359         result = true;
00360     }
00361     return result;
00362 }
00363 
00364 bool isHaploid(const SpecialSnpMap& snpMap, const std::string& probeset_name) {
00365     bool result = false;
00366     SpecialSnpMapIter snpMapIter = snpMap.find(probeset_name);
00367     if (snpMapIter != snpMap.end() && isHaploid(snpMapIter)) {
00368         result = true;
00369     }
00370     return result;
00371 }
